website_summaries.verdict: Captures high-res 4K video; highest transfer speeds of any model we considered; good SD card for modern video recording devices.
pros: transfer speeds up to 300 Mbps for clear, continuous capture of 4K video
Designed for modern digital and action cameras
compatible with almost all brands and models with SD card readers
Available in storage capacities up to 128 GB
cons: May not be compatible with many older models

customer_reviews.title: Two cards, both corrupting photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with a new Sony A7RIII. I'm running this card as my primary with a SanDisk in slot 2. The first card I got corrupted an entire photoshoot and I was left with only my JPG backups on card 2. It happens unfortunately so I sent it back and got another one. Now I decided to shoot raw on both cards just in case. Every few photos I still get a completely scrambled, corrupted picture on the Sony card and zero issues on the second card. Absolute garbage cards for this price. Sending card #2 back now and going to another brand. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Davemex

customer_reviews.title: I didn't believe the negative reviews. Until I had the exact same issue they stated.
customer_reviews.text: This card has malfunctioned on me after only a month of use for no apparent reason in the middle of a critical shoot, causing me to lose a ton of important pictures. It can't be accessed by the camera, PC, or any other device for that matter. It simply doesn't show up, like nothing is inserted. I cannot check it for errors or even format it. It simply died, just like that. I returned the card to Amazon, and I'll be looking for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Izat alawi

customer_reviews.title: You might lose your files!
customer_reviews.text: Did a shoot with an Olympus OMD EM-1 II, shooting both raw and jpeg on one card. I was shooting a dance event, and did a lot of high speed shooting. Images were on the card, as I could review them in camera. But the download was painfully slow, and then finished with a long list of files that "couldn't be downloaded." The next day, I tried again, and this time...nothing. Put the card in the camera, "Card Error!" Put card in two different computers, nothing. I doubt I can recover when the card won't even mount. I did get perhaps 75% of files on the first round. Very disappointing for a $100 card.
customer_reviews.author: High Acutance

customer_reviews.title: 0 firmware and it works great! No problems using it with All-I 400/Mbs in ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sony SF-G128/T1 for the GH5 v2.0 firmware and it works great! No problems using it with All-I 400/Mbs in any setting. While it doesn't have the V90 designation, it's speed is plenty fast for using with the GH5 v2.0 firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Green Builder

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast on the Fuji X-T2. It definitely writes ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightning fast on the Fuji X-T2. It definitely writes faster than the Lexar 2000x SD Cards, which have been my mainstay for a few years. I’ll update this review accordingly if any issues pop up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mijares

customer_reviews.title: Need for Speed
customer_reviews.text: UHS-II cards are indeed crazy fast. If you have a camera that will operate at those speeds (such as my Sony A7RIII), then you owe it to yourself to take advantage of that speed. It makes burst and continuous shooting so much easier when your buffer can keep up. If you don't photograph a lot of action or use burst/continuous shooting much, the extra speed may be unnecessary for you. These cards are VERY pricey for the amount of storage they hold, though, so I would only get them if you know you're going to need the extra speed. Otherwise a UHS-I card will serve you just fine for half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Hensley

customer_reviews.title: I do recommend it if you are using A9
customer_reviews.text: Fast speed, it fixes my A7R3 perfectly. I do recommend it if you are using A9,A7R3,A7M3. It will save you huge time when you shoot continiously. And this is fastest SD card in the world.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Pan

customer_reviews.title: Fast fast fast
customer_reviews.text: They're fast. I have a Sony A9. If you have an A9 like I do, you have to buy these cards. You'll go from waiting FOREVER for the buffer to empty with your old Extreme Pros (remember how we thought those were good?) to it being much faster. It basically makes the camera usable for high burst. My only real complaint with these cards is the ridiculous price. More than two hundred pounds of bananas for a 128GB card. It's a bit... bananas.
customer_reviews.author: B-Rad

customer_reviews.title: First card I've ever had fail
customer_reviews.text: I've bought SanDisk cards forever and someone convinced me to get one of these for 4K recording and the first time out we had a corrupted card and we can't recover the video. I've never had that happen before. The most expensive card I've bought and it went bad on the first run with it. I would return it but I don't have the packaging anymore. I'd go with SanDisk Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this $100+ 64GB card failed after only 6 months of use. In many years of digital photography, I have never had a card fail... until now. And sadly, it was the most expensive of all the cards I've purchased. It worked wonderfully in my Sony A7RIII... until it didn't. Now no computer, card reader, camera or other device will even acknowledge its presence, therefore I cannot even reformat it to make it usable again. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: LOST PICTURES!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 months and every time I go to transfer photos onto my laptop there is an issue with the drive. My laptop fixes the issues and then I am able to access and save my photos but I am worried that I should stop using it in case I lose photos one day. Really disappointing because I thought buying the Sony brand for my Sony camera would be the best. UPDATE: I gave it one more shot and lost pictures! I will not use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tasciana Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Fast
customer_reviews.text: If your camera and reader will accommodate these cards, they are very worthwhile. They enable almost continuous raw shooting with a SonyA7Riii. They are of no use without a compliant camera and reader.
customer_reviews.author: abacus

customer_reviews.title: Zip Zoom!
customer_reviews.text: Overkill for me but awesomely fast. It actually is the most helpful when I transfer images from card to computer, as I don’t often shoot photos at super high frame-rates. You will need a card reader that takes advantage of the speed this card offers to really appreciate it, although it works fine in my other card readers too, just not as crazy fast.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Tested in iMac Pro
customer_reviews.text: Some people were saying they received a counterfeit card. I tested the one I received from CamHouse in the iMac Pro's built-in UHS-II reader using Blackmagic Disk Speed Test. Write: 208 MB/s Read: 257 MB/s It seems to be legit, although the results are less than the advertised 300 MB/s. The 128 GB card can hold 2.5 hours of video on a Sony camera using XAVC S 100M.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performance over price!
customer_reviews.text: This is one EXPENSIVE CARD However...... I didn't purchase a Sony A7R3 to look at the buffer fill up then have to wait to write 80MB RAW files to the card. This card keeps up with me and my 10FPS burst mode, I just hope the life of it keeps up as well. would knock star off for price, but im not feeling that salty today
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: Corrupted files
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these cards right after purchasing Sony a7iii this month. Decided to spend extra month to go with the best possible UHS-II card I could. Lost files from 2 of my last 3 major client shoots!!! Biggest waste of $200+ of my life. Been shooting professionally for years and I have never in my life lost files due to a corrupted card. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was great
customer_reviews.text: 8 months later the card failed. I'm leaving my review 5 stars, but I cannot recommend this anymore. When it did work it worked flawlessly, but today I plugged it in and the data is readable, but its only reading in spits. It will transfer 1 photo, wait 1-2 minutes, then do another one. I've tried it on multiple machines. I don't believe it came with a warranty and if it did I didn't fill it out so I'm SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Pettit

customer_reviews.title: So Fast!!!
customer_reviews.text: When this card fills up and my Sony switches to the other card, I can't shoot as fast, my camera slows down with dozens of pictures in the buffer, I can't switch camera modes until the buffer clears, my ability to capture the moment is noticeably hampered. When you're shooting fast-moving sports or children, this card by itself takes your photographic skills up a notch. If you're shooting events or sports in RAW, you need this card.
customer_reviews.author: KennethF

customer_reviews.title: It might be the fastest, but I did not notice any difference.
customer_reviews.text: I am conflicted on how to review this. It does what it claims to do, very fast read and write for my sony a7 iii camera... But, I also used the samsung sd card that is 85% less money and about 33% slower and I do not see any noticeable difference with the camera's operation. Seriously. I have not yet tried video, but for photography and even continuous shooting, I do not see any difference. My advice is to save your money and buy the lower priced sd card.
customer_reviews.author: The Key Master

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use these cards for video you need to understand that the file size is very misleading. The whole point of these cards is to be able to record at the highest quality, which for me meant 4K, 10 bit Log, All Intra setting. With that in mind a clip that is a little over a minute long is 3.88GB. Meaning that in a 128GB card you can get about 35 minutes of video. The cards are great, but will fill up fast, so be sure you pay attention to capacity and file size.
customer_reviews.author: JimRoot

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY Card I put in my cameras for important shoots.
customer_reviews.text: I use Micro Four Thirds Digital Cameras and they are known to eat batteries, and a lot of that battery burn is attributed to processing of data or failure to do so... The fact is, while the camera is processing (buffering) I am potentially missing the shots I went into to the wilderness to photograph! This card is super fast, super reliable, and not that much more expensive than average cards. I like dependable and this card is fast and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: The Good Doctor!Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. I purchased this card thinking I would spend a bit more to get a quality card from my camera's manufacturer (Sony A7iii, Sony a7ii). After only 7 months of use it has failed. It isn't recognized by any of my cameras or computers. I am not a pro, I do not shoot day in and day out, this card should have lasted MUCH longer. Disappointed. I expected better from Sony.
customer_reviews.author: W. S. Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but one of the best out there.
customer_reviews.text: Need the fastest most reliable memory cards out there for modern professional grade dslr cameras and Sony makes some of the best. The only downside is the price. Hopefully, the price will drop once the fast, large, UHII mem cards become more available.
customer_reviews.author: Strodav

customer_reviews.title: really fast UHS-II card
customer_reviews.text: with Sony MRW-S1 UHS-II reader: 262 MB/s read, 243 MB.s write.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no hiccups,  using this memory card with Sony a7IIIr
customer_reviews.text: I have found the Sony memory card perform better than others. I have never experienced a Sony card memory failure but have all too often experience the pain of other cards when used in the slot 1 location. I was stunned by an inability to write to several of the SanDisk cards that came with a known defect in the card controller relevant to the Sony A73r and a A72r cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Monahan

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Sony SD cards.  It died just past warranty period.
customer_reviews.text: I used the card about three times with my new Sony Rx1rii camera. I was doing a portrait photo shoot and the card suddenly died in the middle of it and neither the camera nor my computers will acknowledge that the card even exists, and I've tried using various software programs. Nothing. Lost my shoot and the disk, and I'm devastated over the loss of the pics and out over $100. I've spent two weeks now still trying to recover photos. Dead.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K. Layton

customer_reviews.title: A7riii compatibility issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my Sony A7rIII. Card seems to be corrupt as it’s giving me issues when I attempt to review photos. It causes my camera to lock up. Unfortunately I cannot return this now, as I opened the package too late to discover this issue. Buyer beware, this seems to be a common issue with the A7rIII.
customer_reviews.author: Trop

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised in my Fuji X-H1. Quick write ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised in my Fuji X-H1. Quick write and maximizes the buffer. Camera has experienced no lock up with these cards. I only shoot with 32GB - no need to tempt fate...
customer_reviews.author: tokenography_com

customer_reviews.title: GH5 400mbps - Writing smooth as can be
customer_reviews.text: GH5 ALL-Intra at 400mbps with V-Log working spectacularly. Never had one issue writing unlike the Delkin V60 cards I was struggling with before. These cards will do the trick, no fuss.
customer_reviews.author: E. Raitses

customer_reviews.title: worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: very fast read and write speeds. this is critical when recording 4k video at 100mb bitrate. if you want good quality video, this card is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: Marks Tech

customer_reviews.title: Expensive mistake.
customer_reviews.text: I sacrificed capacity to splurge on speed. Turns out I sacrificed both. It works fine, it stores files, but after trying it on several systems and devices both at home and work, it isn't any faster than any of my older, lower class, less expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: The Red Button

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but fast
customer_reviews.text: If you're shooting fast and want quality this is your go to card. The main problem I have with this card is the cost!
customer_reviews.author: J. Proffitt

customer_reviews.title: You really Notice the Write Speed
customer_reviews.text: I have used SD cards my whole life and with this one you can really utilize the performance of your camera. it writes as fast as your shutter flickers! reliable reading on Macs, PC's, UHS1 and UHS2 Readers! Even works on my iPhone SD Card Adapter!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Soldate

customer_reviews.title: Became corrupted after 5 months.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this Sony media card to stop working after just 5 months. It is corrupted. Bought April 20, 2018 and in September 2018 I noticed that my deleted photos were reappearing, even after formatting the card. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Fraser

customer_reviews.title: One of the fastest cards I have use it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card to storage 4K footage from my camera. The camera have demanding specs for that and I'm very happy with the speed, quality and overall results that this card gave me so far. I did not have tested the speed but I have no complaints when using it with my system, if were not fast enough the system I would have let me know of that
customer_reviews.author: Nestmac

customer_reviews.title: Repeated corruption issue with recent card purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've used this card since 2018 and recently purchased a second one for additional storage -- the second card has had repeated corruption issues and permanently lost many photos from a recent once in a lifetime wilderness trip even after reformatting mid-trip. The first card has worked fine throughout its lifetime -- same camera for each so I can only guess that the second card is faulty. Very disappointing -- I would expect more for paying top dollar for an SD card.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonConsumer88

customer_reviews.title: Works great in our camera!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this card to speed up picture taking process. We have a 4k vid camera that is kinda slow when saving still pics. This card halved the speed, so it is living up to the reason we purchased it. As long as it keeps functioning, we recommend it for shooting faster pics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To be honest with you. Sony SF-G64 fastest SD card in the world!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card for my A7 III. so fast, it fixes my A7iii perfectly. we can save time when you videoshoot and download picture and video. this is fastest SD card in the world. I love it!! :)
customer_reviews.author: sung kue jang

customer_reviews.title: Seems good
customer_reviews.text: Have not really used yet other than shooting some tests shots but I will write a more comprehensive review once I've used it on a day set aside for imaging but it did come on time.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Becareful I had tons of Issues
customer_reviews.text: Super bummed. Bought 2x of these for my brand new A7III camera. Randomly the camera would state it didn't see the Sony G cards inserted. Id has to pop the battery and repower the camera to recover using the cards. Started happening so much I stopped using these in the field. Wish I could get a refund as these were expensive :( My Delkin BLACK cards same size and speed I had zero issues
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Rupas

customer_reviews.title: A two hundred fifteen dollar card that fails in an RX100 VA.
customer_reviews.text: The card would work sometimes. The quality one could pull off of this card was good and sometimes great. This particular card started failing after I had started using it for class. Sometimes you'd be surprised with quality, then lag during playback, most of all, the card would erase all data to recover itself. I constantly had to reformat this loss of a card. Be on top of your returns and return policies before purchase. If one can 't get back every penny after usage, then don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best SD card I have ever bought for my Sony a7iii. It is much faster than other SD cards I have and the write speed has allowed me to be able to get back to shooting in seconds and not have to wait there for the images or video to write.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Works great with GH5 All-intra 400mbs codec
customer_reviews.text: I use these with my gh5 and so far no issues. A bit pricey but it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: angel

customer_reviews.title: reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the 32GB card in my Fuji X-T2 mirrorless for over 2 years and after shooting thousands of photos it has never once caused any issues.
customer_reviews.author: college mom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If your camera supports it this is *really* fast. If not then it's just another 64Gb card.
customer_reviews.author: baxkr

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 5d mark 3 don't buy this card because it is only works in 20mb/s speed (as any other sd card in this 5d). But the card is working as advertised if used where it is compatible. There is not so much options actually that is so fast and not astronomically expensive, good buy.
customer_reviews.author: alexey demidov

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance as expected from Sony. I have always been satisfied with my orders from Focus Camera. TS
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Should have listenned before it was too late
customer_reviews.text: Just had my photoshoot wrecked by this card. My client was understanding, but I can't trust these ever again. Not worth the risk. Bought over six months ago with medium use...ugh. Money lost.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle - The Yellow Dart

customer_reviews.title: Good Card
customer_reviews.text: This is a great card; however, It crashed on me once and I lost a ton of footage. I sent it off to Sony and they couldnt recover it. Other than that one mishap, its been a good card.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: This Memory Card is fast!
customer_reviews.text: I really don't have to say much about this memory card, as it does what it is intended to do. It transfers information really quickly and it works well in my A7III. I absolutely have no doubt that it will be what you need!
customer_reviews.author: Avrey Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for SONY a7RIII
customer_reviews.text: This memory card was highly recommended for my SONY a7RIII and I am not disappointed by its performance. Feel it was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a7riii
customer_reviews.text: I had some lexar cards in my older a7rii, but when I upgraded to the a7riii, the lexar cards did not meet performance requirements. These sony cards are fast and work perfectly in the a7riii.
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Great for Slot 1 on Sony a7iii
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow is thing fast. I shoot a lot of RAW with my Sony a7iii with continous hi and this card paired with the body doesn't fail. Just wish both SD slots supported the standard.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hall

customer_reviews.title: ... to to a data error recovery on the camera pretty often. The Lexar version was failing on the ...
customer_reviews.text: It works on the Sony A7 III body but still needs to to a data error recovery on the camera pretty often. The Lexar version was failing on the A7iii so badly, I was losing shots waiting for it to recover. I put the Lexar back into the A6500 where it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Easadude

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and a Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Based on reputation and availability I purchased this for my new camera and though I haven't used it a lot it is working fine and the extra speed is a real bonus. I wish they were a bit less expensive but they are worth the premium.
customer_reviews.author: Philip E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: You can trust. Pro
customer_reviews.text: Needed a very high performance SDHC (limit 32GB) to use in my recording studio. Couldn't afford any fail. Bingo!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Ficarelli

customer_reviews.title: Speed is great, price hurts - a lot
customer_reviews.text: The speed is great. There is a definite improvement over the Sony M. You can get about 41 straight pics with the a7iii (max quality settings) before the buffer fills as opposed to the 31 pics offered up by the M.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: I figured, why not go for this card to take advantage of the UHS-II slot in my Sony a77mkIII, only to start reading all the various reviews on Amazon. I guess it's a good thing I haven't sold off my Sandisk ones yet, so I'll be running them along side until I can confirm if I have a dud. No idea how long that'll take, but I'm willing to give them the opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: wild_one

customer_reviews.title: A++++
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing, wish i would’ve gotten 2 or more. I don’t need 128gb, I like to spread out my memory cards in 32gb or 64gb. Just the way I perfer to organize my gear. Fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Landenpk

customer_reviews.title: Sony brand cards are the way to go
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t touched a camera in 10 years till now but man is this card quick! It should be paired with the High speed UHS-ii reader so you can see the speed results. Works fine with my a7iii. Highly recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Surge

customer_reviews.title: Great SDHC card
customer_reviews.text: Needed a SDHC card to record and very high quality video. Works great with the fast write speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: failed after 4 months of use in my sony 17r111 camera.
customer_reviews.text: I have never had problems with any sd card until I spent the extra money to be able to have faster transfer of the denser files associated with 42 megapixel photos. failed after 4 months. very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blazing Fast for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I have other SD cards for my Sony a7RIII but this one is by far the best. Shooting High Speed I got 30 shots without the card bogging down. Super happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: The Fastest !
customer_reviews.text: Amazing ! If you whant to read it on a computer at 300 MB/s I recommand you to use the SONY card reader like the MRWS1
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: the item has been received, the item is good and satisfied with the service
customer_reviews.author: INDOTOY

customer_reviews.title: It’s faster and better than most cards.
customer_reviews.text: For use in a Sony a7ll It’s processing , and downloading speeds are better than most cards.
customer_reviews.author: APGMinnesota

customer_reviews.title: cannot remember where they left you
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had purchased this in the 128 gig version. Tried ordering a 2nd ing it delivery was a total mess.
customer_reviews.author: Bluestill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card
customer_reviews.text: I used this card on an A7SII extensively for UHD video recordings without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great card!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal card for my Camera...4K to photos at 11 pics a sec...this keeps up without missing a beat
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Fastest out there!
customer_reviews.text: These G series are the fastest out there. High quality and I've never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Burned again by Amazon Warehouse
customer_reviews.text: Late to write this review, but just threw this $200 card in the garbage. Purchased as an amazon warehouse buy and it was not a wise. The card has flaws that formatting and disk repair tools will not fix. Word to the wise. Buy new cards.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Poor Product Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these cards from Amazon. I shoot mostly tethered, so the cards stay in the camera most of the time. On both cards a tiny piece of plastic has broken off at one end and I can't use the cards. I expected higher quality from Sony. I can't find any way to return these to Amazon, so I am stuck with two unusable cards and I need to find new cards that won't have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Square Rigger

customer_reviews.title: The best UHS II SDXC Card
customer_reviews.text: The speed of this card at the price point when I purchased this was the best value you can get. Works completely fine with my EOS R. Lightning fast transfer speed and buffering rate for continuous or 4K ALL-I shooting.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! This speeds up my write time so much that I can hardly believe it. If you're shooting long exposures or on high speed, it's a must.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speed and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speed both in camera and downloads to computer. No issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Present
customer_reviews.text: Memory card was a hit with our son, as it gave him greater capability with his camera. Avid photographer!
customer_reviews.author: George Murati

customer_reviews.title: If you shot Sony compress Raw to fit more. For greater detail uncompressed.
customer_reviews.text: Blazingly fast, trusted it to hold all my data for a trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B.

customer_reviews.title: Writes to Card FAST
customer_reviews.text: Didn't disappoint. Writes to card fast. No frustration with missed shots. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Super fast!
customer_reviews.text: Super fast, can keep up with burst photography. Fast transfers back to my laptop for editing. Very happy with these cards!
customer_reviews.author: Nick R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Is very fast and very useful for shooting in burst
customer_reviews.author: dragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SD to use it with my Nikon D500. It gives around 50 raw shots before the buffer fills, and it clears out in about 4.5 seconds. when shooting large fine JPEG, I was able to shoot 200 shots before the buffer fills, and it clears out in a second. Overall I am satisfied with this card.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Failed after routine use for six months
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of money. All the talk about sturdiness and performance is a sham. Card failed while burst shooting after six months of extremely light use...not by damage to the card, improper formatting, exposure to water, by simply using as it is advertised to be exceptional for. Will never buy a Sony card again.
customer_reviews.author: timothy fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and in one piece.. can't ask for more..
customer_reviews.author: Will Love

customer_reviews.title: Read/Write Speed
customer_reviews.text: If you are using a Blackmagic Design Hyperdeck Mini and you want to record or playback graphics in 4K; you must buy this card. Any other SD Card that does not read/write at 300 mb/s will not work recording 4K. This card is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: TPS

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I wish it wasn’t so expensive but it seems like everything is these days.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect card and great price
customer_reviews.text: This SD card is perfect! It’s super fast and feels very durable. For the price it’s really a great deal. Will definitely be buying another one in the future
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Works well with new 4K video camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this for the new Panasonic HC-WXF1 4K video camera. I've shot a few musical and dance performances with it and it has worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gralfus

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Sony !
customer_reviews.text: Does what it was expected to do ... I’ll be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Hutchings

customer_reviews.title: Super fast and work perfect for my Sony A7III
customer_reviews.text: They are super fast and work perfect and hold a lot of memory space. They are super expensive though
customer_reviews.author: lwild04

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased three of these cards, used them in cinema cameras and to shoot 4k with a 5d mark iv. Never had any trouble with buffering speeds, and transfer to hard drive is lighting fast as well. A bit pricey but time is money and these cards simplify the process.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Super fast
customer_reviews.text: If used in a supported high speed camera/card reader/socket, this sd card reaches full 300MB/s speed, truly amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: 300mb/s is worth it
customer_reviews.text: If you use this on a regular daily basis and shoot videe all the time, 300mb/s will help you copy all that material way faster than with other SD cards. And thats worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Matko

customer_reviews.title: Good card!
customer_reviews.text: If you got the need for speed, this is your card.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Flash memory.
customer_reviews.text: Its a flash card and it works as a flash card should. Its also fast. But all flash cards are fast. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Insomniac

customer_reviews.title: Very fast
customer_reviews.text: Amazing speed in Sony A7R3. That's basically all you need to know, because chances are you're here because of A7R3's 42MP raw files.
customer_reviews.author: Some Dude

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Very fast cards and reliable! No issues to report. This is great for the first card slot on the a7 III/a7R III/a9
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Uhs 2 is worth it
customer_reviews.text: Using this on my Xt3 and it’s blazing fast and buffer clears insanely well
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Riddle

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife's Olympus OMD EM1. The main reason was for high speed pictures as she was experiencing quite a bit of lag with a 90 ish MB/s SD. She has yet to use it for this type of shot, but there have been no issues as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Eric R. Mularz

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Sony A7R3 is unable to read after 4 months. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Dcdcdc

customer_reviews.title: Seems promising, cant wait till Amazon fixes my camera and lens order.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as intended. More than enough storage for my Sony a7Riii
customer_reviews.author: z4chburris

product_meta.title: Sony SF-G64/T1 High Performance 64GB SDXC Uhs-II Class 10 U3 Memory Card with Blazing Fast Read Speed Up to 300MB/S
product_meta.description: Capacity:64GBSony is pleased to introduce the world's fastest series of UHS-II SD cards, raising the performance bar Available to professional photographers and videographers. This new SF-G series of UHS-II cards is Sony new top of the line SD cards, with a blazing fast read speed of up to 300MB/s and an industry leading writing speed of up to 299MB/s. Used with mid-to-high end digital cameras, video camcorders and other devices that support UHS-II SD cards, the new SF-G series of UHS-II high Performance SD cards, available in capacities up to 128GB, are Rated for 4K video shooting, maximizing workflow efficiency whether transferring data or burst shooting and continuous shooting.
feature_bullets: In UHS-II devices, up to 300MB/s transfer speed and up to 299MB/s write speed
Uhs-ii reader (mrw-s1) is needed to realize transfer speed
32GB, 64GB, 128GB Capacity models for all your image and video needs
For use with digital cameras and other devices utilizing SD Memory cards
Fast writing minimizes lag time for fast motion photos and videos, burst mode shooting
Especially good for 4K continuous shooting and burst shooting
Also for use in UHS-I cameras, with up to 95MB/s read and 90MB/s write speed
Downloadable File Rescue software helps recover photos and videos that have been accidentally damaged or deleted
High speed SD UHS-II Memory cards are water proof and designed to perform under a wide range of operating temperatures

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars670 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
